narrative.title: La Spezia Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: Italian Air-Borne Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Shattered defensive infantry division in final Tunisia Campaign battles. Division suffered devastating losses at Mareth Line (March 1943), fought delaying action at Wadi Akarit (6-7 April 1943), then retreated to Enfidaville perimeter where it remained static until final surrender May 13, 1943. By April 1943, division reduced to approximately 34% of March strength due to combat casualties and prisoners.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Tunisian coastal plains near Enfidaville - defensive positions in final perimeter

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Airborne training retained (individual soldier quality) despite heavy casualties
Experienced in defensive warfare after 6 months continuous combat
Determination to hold positions despite hopeless strategic situation

environment.terrain_type: Tunisian coastal plains near Enfidaville - defensive positions in final perimeter
